page.title: 05Oystercatchers at Melling.
page.content: Inland riparian breeding at Melling first occurred in 1928. The numbers gradually increased,particularly since 1970 <by 7.5% per annum>, with now 85 riparian and 20 agrarian pairs and 60 none breeding birds. Behavioural adapt- ation to enable feeding, on Lumbricids Tipulid larvae,surface-dwelling invert- ebrates and coprophilous larvae, has occurred. Egg-laying has been advanced to April,so the young hatch to coincide with the maximum food supply in May. Mean clutch size is 2.7 but only 11.2% of eggs laid produce flying young and mean productivity=0.4 young per pair.Domestic stock cause greatest mortality. Nest site availability and territoriality are limiting factors so production is density dependent.Winter- ing in Morecambe Bay,the survival rate of adults is 86%. Mean life expectancy is est.at 12.37<male>and 10.31<female>.
